theory: Blackbeard is not a single entity but three separate beings inhabiting one body, which explains his ability to have multiple Devil Fruits and his unique physiology.
author: Reddit community (r/OnePiece)
evidence: Blackbeard's three-headed Jolly Roger flag
His ability to possess multiple Devil Fruits (unique in the series)
Marco's comment about Blackbeard's 'atypical body structure'
Blackbeard's reference to 'them' when discussing his plan
Never seen sleeping, suggesting multiple consciousnesses taking turns
communitySupport: Mixed - Popular theory with substantial evidence but no official confirmation
counterArguments: No direct canonical evidence of multiple beings
Could be explained by other unique circumstances
Oda has not confirmed this theory

theory: Shiryu joined Blackbeard because he knew Magellan would imprison him again after the crisis was over, making betrayal his only path to freedom.
author: Never Watched One Piece (Tumblr)
evidence: Shiryu was released temporarily only to deal with Blackbeard
His imprisonment was for excessive violence, a pattern unlikely to change
Magellan would have no reason to keep him free after the crisis
Shiryu immediately killed the guards, showing he had already decided to betray
communitySupport: Generally accepted as a logical explanation for Shiryu's actions
counterArguments: Shiryu might have simply been opportunistic rather than calculated
The theory assumes rationality from a character defined by bloodlust

theory: Impel Down's awakening revelation in this arc foreshadows the importance of Devil Fruit awakenings in later arcs, particularly for Luffy.
author: TV Tropes Forum users
evidence: Impel Down arc is the first to explicitly mention Devil Fruit awakening
The awakened Zoan guards in Impel Down demonstrate the concept
Luffy later achieves awakening with the Gomu Gomu no Mi / Hito Hito no Mi Model: Nika
The arc serves as narrative setup for this important power system
communitySupport: Widely accepted in retrospect after later story developments

theory: Blackbeard's true objective in invading Impel Down was specifically to recruit Shiryu, not just any Level 6 prisoners.
author: Fan community analysis
evidence: Episode 452 reveals Blackbeard invaded to release Shiryu
Shiryu's swordsmanship complements the crew's abilities
Blackbeard seemed to know about Shiryu's imprisonment
The timing of the invasion coincided with when Shiryu would be most vulnerable to recruitment
counterArguments: Blackbeard also recruited other Level 6 prisoners
The invasion may have had multiple objectives

theory: Luffy's invasion of Impel Down inadvertently created the perfect opportunity for Blackbeard's plan by dividing the prison's defenses.
author: Multiple analysts and reviewers
evidence: Luffy's escape on Level 4 drew Magellan's attention
Buggy's riot on Level 2 further divided resources
Blackbeard's invasion timing coincided with maximum chaos
The simultaneous crises overwhelmed Impel Down's defenses
communitySupport: Universally accepted as intentional narrative design
